intro: Psychotria kuborensis, commonly known as the Kubo psychotria, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of South America, particularly Ecuador and Peru. The plant is characterized by its dark green, glossy leaves and small, tubular flowers that are typically greenish-yellow in color. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in cloud forests. Due to its ornamental value and potential medicinal properties, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and research settings.
